001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import org.apache.commons.io.FilenameUtils;
004import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
005
006import java.io.File;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.nio.file.Files;
009import java.nio.file.Path;
010import java.nio.file.Paths;
011import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
012import java.util.Base64;
013import java.util.Comparator;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.stream.Collectors;
016import java.util.stream.Stream;
017import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
018
019/**
020 * Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
021 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
022 */
023public class CoreFileUtils {
024
025    /**
026     * Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed content
027     * that allows to use it in HTML-attributes
028     * (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
029     *
030     * @param contentToEncode the text-content to encode
031     * @return Base64-encoded content
032     */
033    public static String encodeBase64(String contentToEncode) {
034        return encodeBase64(contentToEncode.getBytes());
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed array of bytes
039     * that allows to use it in HTML-attributes
040     * (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
041     *
042     * @param bytesArr the binary-content to encode
043     * @return Base64-encoded content
044     */
045    public static String encodeBase64(byte[] bytesArr) {
046        return new String(Base64.getEncoder().encode(bytesArr));
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Load the content of image-file with, encodes its content {@link Base64#getEncoder() Base64-encoder}
051     * and prepend it with corresponding mime-type prefix in order to use that final value
052     * either in HTML-attributes (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
053     * <hr/>
054     * For more advanced detection it's recommended to use <a href="https://tika.apache.org/">Apache Tika</a>
055     *
056     * @param imageFile a file to load the text of binary content
057     * @return a data-string to use in HTML-attributes
058     */
059    public static String imageFileData64(File imageFile) {
060        byte[] imageFileContent = loadFileAsBytes(imageFile);
061        String imageFileExt = FilenameUtils.getExtension(imageFile.getPath());
062        String dataPrefix = switch (imageFileExt.toLowerCase()) {
063            case "jpg", "jpeg" -> "data:image/jpg;base64,";
064            case "png" -> "data:image/png;base64,";
065            case "gif" -> "data:image/gif;base64,";
066            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
067                "could not detect the mime-type of file '%s' by extension '%s",
068                imageFile, imageFileExt));
069        };
070        return dataPrefix + encodeBase64(imageFileContent);
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}.
075     * <hr/>
076     * This operation is inversion of standard static methods {@link Path#of(String, String...)}
077     * or {@link Paths#get(String, String...)} - so, following expressions are identical:<pre>{@code
078     *     pathParts(Path.of("a/b/c"))
079     *     pathParts(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
080     *     Stream.of("a", "b", "c")
081     * }</pre>
082     *
083     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
084     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}
085     */
086    public static Stream<String> pathParts(Path path) {
087        return StreamSupport.stream(path.spliterator(), false).map(Path::toString);
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
092     * - so, following expressions are identical:<pre>{@code
093     *      pathPartsList(Path.of("a/b/c"))
094     *      pathPartsList(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
095     *      List.of("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns unmodifiable implementation of List
096     *      Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns modifiable instance of ArrayList
097     * }</pre>
098     *
099     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
100     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
101     */
102    public static List<String> pathPartsList(Path path) {
103        return pathParts(path).toList();
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Joining the {@link #pathParts(Path) stream of path components} with {@link File#separator}
108     * - so, the assertions like following are always correct:<pre>{@code
109     *     assertThat(pathPartsStr(Path.of("a/b/c"))).isEqualTo("a/b/c")
110     * }</pre>
111     * <hr/>
112     * There could be some surprises with un-normalized parts of path, which includes reference to parent directory.
113     * Such cases must be handled and tests properly, because the family of methods {@code pathPartsXXX} is
114     * just a pure representation of path-parts without additional handling them.
115     *
116     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
117     * @return the sequence of {@link Path}-components joining with {@link File#separator}
118     */
119    public static String pathPartsStr(Path path) {
120        return pathParts(path).collect(Collectors.joining(File.separator));
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * The same as {@link #loadFileAsText(File)}, but accept the path to that file as {@link String}
125     *
126     * @param pathToLoadStr the path of file to laod as {@link String}
127     * @return the content of that file as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
128     */
129    public static String loadFileAsText(String pathToLoadStr) {
130        return loadFileAsText(Paths.get(pathToLoadStr).toFile());
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@link String} (it's allowed to use for text-files only)
135     * and throws {@link IllegalStateException} if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
136     *
137     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
138     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
139     */
140    public static String loadFileAsText(File fileToLoad) {
141        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
142            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
143                "could not load the file %s as text, because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
144                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
145        }
146        try {
147            return Files.readString(fileToLoad.toPath());
148        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
149            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
150                "could not load the file '%s' as text, because of IOException", fileToLoad), ioEx);
151        }
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@code byte[]}  and throws {@link IllegalStateException}
156     * if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
157     *
158     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
159     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
160     */
161    public static byte[] loadFileAsBytes(File fileToLoad) {
162        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
163            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
164                "could not load the file %s as bytes, because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
165                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
166        }
167        try {
168            return Files.readAllBytes(fileToLoad.toPath());
169        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
170            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
171                "could not load the file '%s' as bytes, because of IOException", fileToLoad), ioEx);
172        }
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Loading the content of {@code file} as list of lines,
177     * where each line is an element of returning {@link List} of {@link String}.
178     *
179     * @param filePathToLoad path of file to read the content as lines
180     * @return the content of {@code filePathToLoad} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
181     */
182    public static List<String> loadFileLines(Path filePathToLoad) {
183        if (filePathToLoad == null) {
184            throw new IllegalStateException(
185                "the path to file to load lines MUST NOT be null");
186        }
187        try (Stream<String> lines = Files.lines(filePathToLoad)) {
188            return lines.toList();
189        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
190            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
191                "could not load the file '%s' as list of lines", filePathToLoad), ioEx);
192        }
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Saving the content into the file {@code fileToSave} (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated).
197     * All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
198     *
199     * @param fileToSave the file to save into
200     * @param fileContent the content to be saved
201     * @throws IllegalStateException in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)
202     */
203    public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent) {
204        if (fileToSave == null) {
205            throw new IllegalStateException(
206                "could not save the file content, because fileToSave is null");
207        }
208        try {
209            if (fileToSave.getParentFile() != null) {
210                Files.createDirectories(fileToSave.getParentFile().toPath());
211            }
212            Files.writeString(fileToSave.toPath(), fileContent);
213        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
214            throw new IllegalStateException("could not save the content into the file " + fileToSave, ioEx);
215        }
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Copy the file {@code sourceFile} to the file {@code targetFile}
220     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.
221     */
222    public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile) {
223        if (sourceFile == null || !sourceFile.isFile()) {
224            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
225                "could not copy the file %s because it's not a normal file",
226                sourceFile == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + sourceFile + "'"));
227        }
228        if (targetFile == null) {
229            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
230                "could not copy the file '%s' because target file is null", sourceFile));
231        }
232        try {
233            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
234                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
235            }
236            Files.copy(sourceFile.toPath(), targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
237        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
238            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
239                "could not copy the file '%s' into '%s' because of IOException",
240                sourceFile, targetFile), ioEx);
241        }
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * The same as {@link Files#deleteIfExists(Path)}, but ignore any kind of {@link IOException}.
246     * <hr/>
247     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> For non-empty directory the method {@link #removeSilent(File)} should be used,
248     * because this method will always return {@code false} for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
249     *
250     * @param pathToRemove the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
251     * @return {@code true} if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or {@code false} otherwise
252     */
253    public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove) {
254        if (pathToRemove == null) {
255            return false;
256        }
257        try {
258            return Files.deleteIfExists(pathToRemove);
259        } catch (IOException ignored) {
260            return false;
261        }
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
266     *
267     * @param fileOrDirToRemove path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
268     * @return the number of removed items
269     */
270    public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove) {
271        if (fileOrDirToRemove == null) {
272            return -1;
273        }
274        if (!fileOrDirToRemove.exists()) {
275            return 0;
276        }
277        try {
278            if (fileOrDirToRemove.isFile()) {
279                return fileOrDirToRemove.delete() ? 1 : 0;
280            }
281            try (Stream<Path> walkPathStream = Files.walk(fileOrDirToRemove.toPath())) {
282                return (int) walkPathStream.sorted(Comparator.reverseOrder()) // Sort in reverse order to delete contents before directories
283                    .filter(CoreFileUtils::removePathSilent)
284                    .count();
285            }
286        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
287            return -2;
288        }
289    }
290}
